utilities

Interface QueueADT<E>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MyQueue

    public interface QueueADT<E>
extends java.io.Serializable
    This is the professional Queue Interface for Advanced Object Oriented Programming (CRPG 311) at SAIT Polytechnic. This Queue embodies all the standard Queue operations, and includes several helper methods that will give the data structure more flexibility and use. Created On: June 4, 2004 Updated On: Dec. 3, 2010 Updated On: Nov 15, 2018 by kitty Queue.java

      Dequeue will remove the first item that was placed in the Queue.
      void dequeueAll()
      dequeueAll removes all items in the queue.

      Enqueue will place the added item at the last position in the queue.
      boolean equals(QueueADT<E> that)
      Used to compare two Queue ADT's.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true when the queue contains no items.

      (Optional Method) Returns true if the number of items in the queue equals the length.

      Returns an iterator over the elements in this queue in proper sequence.
      E peek()
      Peek provides a reference to the first item in the queue without removing from the queue.

      Returns the length of the current queue as an integer value.

      E[] toArray(E[] holder)
      Returns an array containing all of the elements in this list in proper sequence; the runtime type of the returned array is that of the specified array.

    • Method Detail

      • enqueue

        void enqueue(E toAdd)
      throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Enqueue will place the added item at the last position in the queue. This method will not allow null values to be added to the Queue.
        Parameters:
        toAdd - the item to be added to the Queue.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - raised when a null object is placed in the Queue.

      • dequeue

        E dequeue()
   throws EmptyQueueException
        Dequeue will remove the first item that was placed in the Queue.
        Returns:
        the first item in the Queue.
        Throws:
        EmptyQueueException - raised when the queue's length is zero (0).

      • peek

        E peek()
throws EmptyQueueException
        Peek provides a reference to the first item in the queue without removing from the queue.
        Returns:
        the first item in the queue.
        Throws:
        EmptyQueueException - raised when the queue's length is zero (0).

      • dequeueAll

        void dequeueAll()
        dequeueAll removes all items in the queue.

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true when the queue contains no items.
        Returns:
        true when queue length is zero (0).

      • iterator

        Iterator<E> iterator()
        Returns an iterator over the elements in this queue in proper sequence.
        Returns:
        an iterator over the elements in this queue in proper sequence.

      • equals

        boolean equals(QueueADT<E> that)
        Used to compare two Queue ADT's. To be equal two queues must contain equal items appearing in the same order.
        Parameters:
        that - the Queue ADT to be compared to this queue.
        Returns:
        true if the queues are equal.

      • toArray

        java.lang.Object[] toArray()
        Returns an array containing all of the elements in this list in proper sequence. Obeys the general contract of the Collection.toArray method.
        Returns:
        an array containing all of the elements in this list in proper sequence.

      • toArray

        E[] toArray(E[] holder)
     throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Returns an array containing all of the elements in this list in proper sequence; the runtime type of the returned array is that of the specified array. Obeys the general contract of the Collection.toArray(Object[]) method.
        Parameters:
        holder - the array into which the elements of this queue are to be stored, if it is big enough; otherwise, a new array of the same runtime type is allocated for this purpose.
        Returns:
        an array containing the elements of this queue.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified array is null.

      • isFull

        boolean isFull()
        (Optional Method) Returns true if the number of items in the queue equals the length. This operation is only implement when a fixed length queue is required.
        Returns:
        true if queue is at capacity.

      • size

        int size()
        Returns the length of the current queue as an integer value.
        Returns:
        the current size to the queue as an integer.
